revised_title: Tectonic Evolution of the Himalayas and Tibet: Folding and Imbrication of the Indian Crust During Himalayan Collision
tldr: This article discusses the tectonic evolution of the Himalayas and Tibet, focusing on the folding and imbrication of the Indian crust during the Himalayan collision. The authors describe the structure of the overthrust Indian Plate and the suture between the Indian and Asian Plates. They also discuss the deformation in the northern plates and provide estimates of the amount of shortening in the region.
